other_tests.findings: The appendix is dilated to 10 mm with hyperemic mucosa and significant surrounding inflammation. There is significant edema of the adjacent cecum, likely reactive. The wall of the appendix, particularly at the tip is not well defined raising concern for perforation. A small amount of fluid seen in the right paracolic gutter, and perhaps a small 11 x 13 mm extraluminal more defined peripherally enhancing collection adjacent to the base of the appendix.
